intro: Dipteracanthus rubicaulis, commonly known as the red-stemmed dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is adapted to high humidity and warm climates. Its leaves are usually alternate and革质 (leathery), providing structural support in its natural habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role in tropical ecosystems.
